title: Israel Recovers Last Hostage Remains
snippets: Israel recovers last hostage body from Gaza, paving way for crossing to open Reuters

Israel has recovered the remains of the last remaining hostage held in Gaza, the military said on Monday, fulfilling a key condition of the initial phase of U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to end the war in the Palestinian territory.
The recovery of Master Sgt. Ran Gvili’s body paves the way for the next stage of the Gaza cease-fire plan, though the path forward is unclear.

However, it could provide more context and detail to be fully constructive.
summary: Israel has recovered the remains of the last hostage held in Gaza, Master Sgt. Ran Gvili, fulfilling a key condition for progressing to the next phase of the Gaza cease-fire plan. This development allows for the potential reopening of the border crossing and further steps in the cease-fire process.

title: At Least 18 Dead

Rescuers saved hundreds more, while

A ferry with more than 350 people on board sank early Monday near an island in the southern Philippines, killing at least 18 people, officials said. Rescuers saved hundreds more, while a fleet of coast guard and naval ships searched for those still missing.
Two dozen people were still missing after the vessel sank early Monday morning in Basilan Province.
